doc:
Michael Martin Harvey https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Martin_Harvey 0 Michael Martin Harvey (born John Selwyn Elton Martin-Harvey, 18 April 1897 – 30 June 1975) was an English actor. He was the son of the stage actor/manager Sir John Martin-Harvey and brother of actress Muriel Martin-Harvey.As well as his theatre work, he had a number of small roles in films throughout the 1930s and 1940s such as Dark Journey (1937), The Drum (1938) and Caesar and Cleopatra (1945). Larger parts came his way towards the late forties and early fifties including The Monkey's Paw (1948), The Third Visitor (1951) and The Long Memory (1952). In 1949 he took on his only lead role, that of real life criminal Charles Peace in The Case of Charles Peace.He married children's book illustrator Hester Margetson in 1927 under the name Jack Seaforth Elton Martin-Harvey. Together they formed a small ballet touring company, the Martin-Harvey Miniature Ballet. In the 1950s he teamed with the composer Margaret More to form the Hans Andersen Players, performing selected works from the work of Hans Christian Andersen. Besides dance his other artistic interests included poetry, painting and pottery. Michael_Martin_Harvey ( born John_Selwyn_Elton_Martin-Harvey , 18_April_1897 – 30_June_1975 ) was an_English_actor . He was the_son of the_stage_actor/manager_Sir_John_Martin-Harvey_and_brother of actress_Muriel_Martin-Harvey . As_well as his_theatre_work , he had a_number of small_roles in films throughout the_1930s_and_1940s such_as Dark_Journey_(_1937_) , The_Drum_(_1938_)_and_Caesar and Cleopatra_(_1945_) . Larger_parts came his_way towards the_late_forties and early_fifties including The_Monkey 's_Paw_(_1948_) , The_Third_Visitor_(_1951_) and The_Long_Memory_(_1952_) . In 1949 he took on his_only_lead_role , that of real_life_criminal_Charles_Peace in The_Case of Charles_Peace.He_married_children 's_book_illustrator_Hester_Margetson in 1927 under the_name_Jack_Seaforth_Elton_Martin-Harvey . Together they formed a_small_ballet_touring_company , the_Martin-Harvey_Miniature_Ballet . In the_1950s he teamed with the_composer Margaret_More to_form the_Hans_Andersen_Players , performing selected_works from the_work of Hans_Christian_Andersen . Besides dance his_other_artistic_interests included poetry_,_painting_and_pottery .
